title: Enumerations
snippet: Type-safe enums with variants and pattern matching
description: Enumerations define algebraic data types with multiple variants. Each variant can be a unit variant (no data), tuple variant (unnamed fields), or struct variant (named fields). Enums enable type-safe state representation and are checked for exhaustiveness in match expressions. Pattern matching destructures enum values to extract data. Enums are perfect for modeling states, messages, results (Ok/Err), options (Some/None), and domain-specific types. This example demonstrates unit variants, tuple variants with data, and exhaustive pattern matching with the match expression.
